Package com.rapidminer.belt.column.io

Class NominalColumnBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rapidminer.belt.column.io.NominalColumnBuilder
  • public final class NominalColumnBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Builder for nominal columns out of ByteBuffers.
    Author:
    Gisa Meier

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      NominalColumnBuilder​(java.util.LinkedHashSet<java.lang.String> dictionaryValues, int size)
      Creates a column builder for a Column.TypeId.NOMINAL column of the given length.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NominalColumnBuilder

        public NominalColumnBuilder​(java.util.LinkedHashSet<java.lang.String> dictionaryValues,
                            int size)
        Creates a column builder for a Column.TypeId.NOMINAL column of the given length. The dictionary of the nominal column is defined via the dictionary values ordered set and the category indices can be put via ByteBuffers containing int, (signed) short or (signed) byte values.
        Parameters:
        dictionaryValues - the dictionary values matching the category indices to be read, must start with null
        size - the length of the column to construct
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the size is negative, the dictionary values are empty or do not start with null
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the dictionary values are null

    • Method Detail

      • position

        public int position()
        Returns the current position until which the data has been written.
        Returns:
        the row index that is written next

      • putIntegers

        public NominalColumnBuilder putIntegers​(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        Puts the integer values in the buffer as category indices into the column starting at the current position().
        Parameters:
        buffer - a buffer containing category indices as ints
        Returns:
        the builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a value in the buffer is not in the range specified by the dictionary
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the buffer is null

      • putShorts

        public NominalColumnBuilder putShorts​(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        Puts the (signed) short values in the buffer as category indices into the column starting at the current position(). This is only supported if it makes sense for the range defined by the dictionary, i.e., if the maximal dictionary index and thus the maximal category index is bigger than Short.MAX_VALUE, then the values must be written via putIntegers(ByteBuffer) and not with this method.
        Parameters:
        buffer - a buffer containing category indices as (signed) shorts
        Returns:
        the builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a value in the buffer is not in the range specified by the dictionary
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the buffer is null
        java.lang.AssertionError - if the maximal dictionary index is too big to allow storing category indices as shorts

      • putBytes

        public NominalColumnBuilder putBytes​(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        Puts the (signed) byte values in the buffer as category indices into the column starting at the current position(). This is only supported if it makes sense for the range defined by the dictionary, i.e., if the maximal dictionary index and thus the maximal category index is bigger than Byte.MAX_VALUE, then the values must be written via putIntegers(ByteBuffer) or putShorts(ByteBuffer) and not with this method.
        Parameters:
        buffer - a buffer containing category indices as (signed) shorts
        Returns:
        the builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a value in the buffer is not in the range specified by the dictionary
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the buffer is null
        java.lang.AssertionError - if the maximal dictionary index is too big to allow storing category indices as shorts

      • toColumn

        public Column toColumn()
        Creates a new column from the builder. If the current position() is smaller than the originally defined column size, the remaining values will be missing values.
        Returns:
        the column defined by the builder

      • toBooleanColumn

        public Column toBooleanColumn​(int positiveIndex)
        Creates a new boolean column with the given positive index from the builder. If the current position() is smaller than the originally defined column size, the remaining values will be missing values.
        Returns:
        the boolean column defined by the builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the dictionary has more than two values
